result.execSummary:
The defendant Albert Dewey Burks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Albert Dewey Burks is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Albert Dewey Burks was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Albert Dewey Burks was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: STRAIGHT TIME, with credit for 0 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
DNA sample - pay the surcharge.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
Complete a parenting class.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: Serve 30 days as to Count 2 and 15 days consecutive as to Count 3 in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 11/06/15.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: STRAIGHT TIME, consecutive, with credit for 0 days time served.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to: 15 days consecutive as to Count 3 in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 11/06/15.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Albert Dewey Burks

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Albert Dewey Burks in court PRO SE.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Albert Dewey Burks in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Albert Dewey Burks in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Albert Dewey Burks in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months STRAIGHT TIME in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days STRAIGHT TIME, consecutive, in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served. 
.
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days as to Count 2 and 15 days consecutive as to Count 3 in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 11/06/15.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-DNA sample - pay the surcharge.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered the child removed from the no contact order.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered case dismissed.  
.
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgments of Conviction.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Albert Dewey Burks in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered penalty enhancers, Repeater, dismissed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Albert Dewey Burks in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  A new offer was just given by the state and defense would like to review it.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Albert Dewey Burks not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Albert Dewey Burks in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Albert Dewey Burks in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Poilice Department Officer Thaddeus Schimmels.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tiffney H. or DTH dob 5/4/4

Defendant Albert Dewey Burks in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Albert Dewey Burks in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
